about.title: About Make the CHANGE
about.intro: Make the CHANGE is an innovative platform that connects engaged citizens with concrete biodiversity projects.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.description: Democratize biodiversity investment by making it accessible, transparent and rewarding.

values.title: Our values

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: Real-time tracking of your investment impact.

values.section_description: We do more than promises. Every platform feature is built to maximize real, measurable impact.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: Tech for Good: AI, satellite, and big data serving nature.

team.title: The visionary team
team.subtitle: Meet the minds turning ecological ambition into reality.

gregory.quote: "Ecology should no longer be a constraint, but an opportunity."
gregory.bio: A passionate entrepreneur, Gregory has spent the last decade building bridges between technological innovation and sustainable impact. His vision: create an ecosystem where every individual action drives concrete biodiversity restoration worldwide.

bartosz.quote: "Transparency is not optional, it is the foundation of trust."
bartosz.bio: An architect of the invisible, Bartosz turns blockchain complexity into a seamless, secure user experience. He ensures every line of code serves the mission: protecting the integrity and impact of every investment.

cta.description: Every action matters. Turn your commitment into real, measurable biodiversity impact.

brand_guidelines.title: Make the Change Brand Guidelines
brand_guidelines.subtitle: Official reference to align visual identity, editorial voice, and product execution across touchpoints.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Brand principles, governance, and consistency framework for Make the Change.

logo.title: Logo
logo.description: Logo usage rules, approved variants, and common misuse examples.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Brand palette, composition ratios, and mapping to UI CSS tokens.

typography.title: Typography
typography.description: Type scale, reading hierarchy, and UI writing best practices.

voice.title: Tone of voice
voice.description: Editorial principles and microcopy examples for consistent communication.

assets.title: Assets
assets.description: Catalog of available brand files, delivery status, and kit access.

overview.title: Build a consistent brand across every touchpoint.
overview.intro: This framework applies to product, marketing, support, and partner communications. Every new interface should comply before release.

trust.title: Trust
trust.description: Prefer clear, verifiable communication with transparent framing.

community.title: Collective impact
community.description: Highlight shared value and the role of the community.

innovation.title: Useful innovation
innovation.description: Use technology to simplify outcomes, not to add visual noise.

authenticity.title: Authenticity
authenticity.description: Prioritize real producers, measurable outcomes, and factual proof.

principles.item1: A page must remain understandable in under 5 seconds.
principles.item2: Visual decisions must be justified by a business objective.
principles.item3: Always prioritize shared design-system tokens and components.
principles.item4: Content must be localized and validated in FR/EN/NL.
principles.item5: Any exception to the guide must be documented and approved.

governance.item2: Engineering validates technical compliance before merge.
governance.item3: Marketing validates voice consistency for public communication.

logo.title: Logo usage rules
logo.intro: The Make the Change logo is a primary asset. Follow approved variants, minimum sizes, and clear-space rules.
logo.main_logo_description: Use the primary version on standard product and marketing surfaces. It is the default on light backgrounds.
logo.clear_space_rule: Keep minimum free space around the logo equal to the height of the main symbol.

do.item2: Maintain strong contrast with the background.
do.item3: Preserve original logo proportions in every format.

dont.item1: Stretch, skew, or rotate the logo.
dont.item2: Change logo colors outside the approved palette.
dont.item3: Add shadows, outlines, or decorative effects.
dont.item4: Place the logo on noisy backgrounds without support.

colors.title: Color system
colors.intro: The palette is structured to keep readability, visual hierarchy, and brand recognition on desktop and mobile.
colors.ratio_description: Use neutral tones as the main base, reinforce structure with primary colors, and reserve accents for key actions.
colors.core_palette_description: These tones are the foundation of the identity. Usage notes reflect current product conventions.

night.name: Night blue
night.role: Main text and strong structural surfaces

colors.tokens_description: Brand colors are implemented through CSS variables and available themes in the app.

typography.title: Typography system
typography.intro: Text hierarchy should stay consistent across marketing pages, product screens, and external material.
typography.scale_description: Apply this scale to preserve a stable reading rhythm across the entire application.
typography.weights_description: Limit the number of weights on a single screen. Use Black/Bold for hierarchy and Regular for content.

best_practices.item1: Prefer left alignment for long-form content.
best_practices.item3: Avoid full uppercase blocks outside short labels.
best_practices.item4: Check text contrast in every active theme.

typography.sample_description: Sample editorial block aligned with hierarchy and readability rules.
typography.sample_body: Every message should explain the action, the impact, and the next step. Form serves understanding.

voice.title: Tone of voice
voice.intro: Make the Change voice is warm, reliable, and action-oriented. Every microcopy should reflect this position.

reassuring.title: Reassuring
reassuring.description: Explain clearly, reduce ambiguity, and avoid vague promises.

collective.title: Collective
collective.description: Emphasize shared contribution and common outcomes.

innovative.title: Innovative
innovative.description: Show technology value in plain and concrete language.

authentic.title: Authentic
authentic.description: Anchor messages in facts, numbers, and field reality.

optimistic.title: Optimistic
optimistic.description: Highlight progress and clear positive next steps.

voice.microcopy_description: Use these formulations as a reference for CTA, statuses, errors, and onboarding.

status.label: Status message
status.good: Contribution confirmed, impact is being calculated.

error.label: Error message
error.good: Payment failed. Check your details and try again.

onboarding.label: Onboarding
onboarding.good: Choose your first project to start your impact journey.

review_items.item1: The message clearly explains the next action.
review_items.item2: The tone stays positive without hiding real constraints.
review_items.item3: Vocabulary remains consistent with the biodiversity mission.

assets.intro: This section centralizes brand resources for product, marketing, and partner teams.
assets.catalog_description: Status indicates operational availability for each resource.

logo_kit.usage: Web, social, print, and product signature usage

assets.download_description: Buttons will be enabled once the final brand kit is approved by Design + Marketing.
assets.note_description: Any external communication must use the latest version published in this section.

meta.title: FAQ - Make the Change
meta.description: Frequently asked questions about Make the Change.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about Make the Change and your impact.
faq.empty_description: Try another keyword or contact support.

points.question: How do points work?
points.answer: Each euro invested in a project generates impact points. You can use them in the marketplace or reinvest them.

tracking.question: Can I track my impact?
tracking.answer: Yes. You get real-time tracking so you can see the concrete impact of your investments.

payment.question: Which payment methods are available?
payment.answer: We currently support cards and bank transfers. The impact wallet will be enabled in an upcoming release.

profile.question: What are profile badges for?
profile.answer: Badges highlight your engagement milestones. You can make your profile public to share your progress.

hero.description_line1: A bold idea? An ambitious project?

email.description: Our team is responsive. Response guaranteed within 24h.

social.title: Social Hub
social.description: Join the conversation and follow our impact in real time.

hero.description_line1: We designed Make the CHANGE with privacy at the core of the experience.

minimal_collection.title: Minimal collection
minimal_collection.description: We only collect data strictly required for your account, orders, and impact tracking.

security.title: Enhanced security
security.description: Sensitive information is never exposed publicly and remains protected with encryption.

contact.title: Any questions?
contact.description: Our DPO team is here to help.

hero.description: Transparency is central to our mission. Here are the rules that govern the platform.

acceptance.title: Terms acceptance
acceptance.body: By using Make the CHANGE, you join a committed community and fully accept these terms of use.

evolution.title: Platform evolution
evolution.body: Make the CHANGE is a living project. Content, points, and mechanics can evolve to better serve the mission.

points.item1: Regular updates to improve the experience

contact.title: Any question?
contact.body: Our team is available for any clarification regarding these terms and platform usage.
